content.description: The following table shows the numbers of students in grades 7 and 8 at a middle school who are participating in extracurricular activities.
content.question: Band Chorus Chess Club Drama Club School Newspaper Grade 7 15 22 8 16 10 Grade 8 16 20 10 25 15 Which of the following statements is supported by the table?

choices.label: Each activity has more grade 8 students than grade 7 students.
The number of students in Band is less than the number of students in the Chess Club.
The total number of grade 7 students is greater than the total number of grade 8 students.
The number of students in the Drama Club is more than twice the number of students in the School Newspaper.
The activity with the greatest number of students is Chorus.

content.answer: The activity with the greatest number of students is Chorus.

topic.text: 1.4: Representing a Categorical Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
